skills.name: knowledge
skills.description: Ability to recall memorized facts, terms, and basic concepts.
skills.example:
What is the fundamental accounting equation?
Assets = Liabilities + Equity
Liabilities = Assets – Equity
Equity = Assets – Liabilities
    Assets = Equity – Liabilities

skills.name: understanding
skills.description: Ability to explain the meaning of facts, terms, and concepts.
skills.example:
If total liabilities decrease and total assets remain the same, equity:     Increases
 Decreases
 Remains the same
 Becomes a liability

skills.name: application
skills.description: Ability to perform work tasks using facts, concepts, techniques, and rules.
skills.example: John’s assets are 7.7m and his equity is 6.3m. What are his liabilities?

skills.name: analysis
skills.description: Ability to diagnose situations and craft solutions using facts, concepts, techniques, and rules
skills.example: A new company has a building that costs $10,000, machinery that costs $5,000, cash of $700, and a bank loan of $7,850. How much more cash would the company need in order to have equity of $10,000?

skills.name: programming
skills.description: Ability to create a program, run and test it.
skills.example: Create a program in C that sum two integers
